course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Biochemistry I
course.description: Major classes of biochemical compounds; primary, secondary, tertiary and quaternary structures of macromolecules; enzyme kinetics and mechanisms; biosynthesis of DNA and RNA; transfer RNA and protein synthesis.
course.prerequisites: LIFS 1901 OR LIFS 1902

reviews.author: myosin
reviews.title: Very good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
Midterm:
L1 Introduction
L2 Amino Acids
L3 Protein Structure I
L4 Protein Structure II
L5 Protein Function and Evolution
L6 Protein Technology
L7 Enzymes and Enzyme Reactions
L8 Enzyme Kinetics I
L9 Enzyme Kinetics II
L10 Enzyme Regulation
L11 Enzyme Cofactors & Coenzymes

Final:
L13 Lipids
L14 Biomembranes
L15 Carbohydrates I
L16 Carbohydrates II
L17 Nucleic Acids
L18 Chromatin Structure
L19 DNA Replication
L20 DNA Repair & Recombination
L21 Transcription & RNA Processing
L22 Protein Synthesis
L23 Genetic Engineering
reviews.comment_teaching:
He teaches very well. He explained everything so clearly. You do not need to attend lectures since there is video provided. Although the content is easy, the exams are hard. You have to be very careful with this.
I must warn everyone to study those 20 proteins very hard. The exams appears a lot about it.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grade and lenient prof.
Very easy to get A range

Midterm: 68/80 (80%) mean around 45/80
Final: Canvas online test(very easy) 20/20 (20%)
Overall: 88/100
Grade: A+

Tips:
Do quicker for the mc in the midterm. Don't stuck on only one question. Otherwise you won't have time to finish all 80 mc in just 70 mins, which is very crazy.
Study more on those 20 proteins.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is high if you want a good grade. Lots of things to remember. Remember to study hard and you deserve good grade.

reviews.author: Fryfat28
reviews.comment_content:
Lecturers abbreviations: Prof QI (RZQ), Prof LIANG (CL), Prof DANG (SD)
Lecture content:
L1 Introduction of biochemistry (SD)
L2 Amino acids (SD)
L3 Protein structure I (SD)
L4 Protein structure II (SD)
L5 Protein function and evolution (SD)
L6 Protein technology (SD)
L7 Enzymes and enzymatic reactions (RZQ)
L8 Enzyme Kinetics I (RZQ)
L9 Enzyme Kinetics II (RZQ)
L10 Enzyme regulation (RZQ)
L11 Enzyme cofactors and coenzymes (RZQ)
L12 Mid term
L13 Lipids (RZQ)
L14 Biomembranes (RZQ)
L15 Carbohydrates I (RZQ)
L16 Carbohydrates II (RZQ)
L17 Nucleic acids (CL)
L18 Chromatin organization (CL)
L19 DNA replication (CL)
L20 DNA repair and recombination (CL)
L21 Transcription and RNA processing (CL)
L22 Protein synthesis (CL)
L23 Genetic engineering (RZQ)
This course is separated according to different biomolecules covered, namely amino acids, lipids, carbohydrates and nucleic acids. Because it is a biochemistry course so the emphasis is placed on learning the structures and interactions of the molecules. Most of the concepts will be relatively easy to understand if you have a strong foundation from CHEM 1020 or 1030.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor QI is the best lecturer among the three. He covers most of the course content and goes through each slide in detail and explains the content very well. He usually takes a 5 min break during the lectures and ends the lecture 5-10 mins before the designated time so students can ask him questions, he's very friendly and always answers the questions patiently.
Professor LIANG is quite good as well, goes through the content slowly and in detail.
Professor DANG is the worst among the three mainly because of his accent, it is so bad that you can barely understand anything he's saying. He tries to answer student's questions but sometimes students have no idea what he is saying.
reviews.comment_grading:
This course has 2 quizzes, 1 mid term and 1 final.
The quizzes takes place before the mid term and final respectively, it mainly serves as revision and practice run before the exams. All the exams are non cumulative, meaning content from mid term will not be covered in the final. All the quizzes and exams are in MC format. I think the grading is fair in terms of UST standard.
Quiz 1: 5/10, mean 5.8
Mid term: 49/70, mean 45.6, SD 9.5
Quiz 2: 9/12, mean 9.3
Final: 67/90, mean 58 (exact SD wasn't released but should be somewhere between 15-20)
Final grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload if you understand all the concepts from the lectures. Because there are no assignments so there isn't much to do except self revision and doing practice questions from the textbook.

reviews.author: hnn
reviews.comment_content: The professor introduces various disciplines in biochemistry. There's a lot of basic biology facts (such as proteins, DNA, lipids) with few additional "more sophisticated? biochemistry-related" information.  I suggest you go to all the classes, as he mentions things that are not in the ppt that appear in the final exam. Overall, if you have background in biology, it will be relatively easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: The best professor I've seen in HKUST so far. Although he does make some minor mistakes in class, he delivers the content in a short but information-packed manner. Also, the class often ends within an hour if he's done teaching. He has amazing time-management skills (unlike many professors in HKUST who are unable to finish one ppt in one lesson). He also arranges many Q&A sessions where you can comfortably ask him any uncertainties.
reviews.comment_grading: I memorised and studied the ppt and any additional information taught in class, and I got an A+. I know that a lot of hard-working students take this course, so I suggest studying hard and ask a lot of questions!
reviews.comment_workload: All the ppts are relatively concise. If you have a good biology background, there is not a lot of new information you have learn.

reviews.author: Jkwk
reviews.title: Worth A Try
reviews.comment_content:
The content is pretty easy overall. Don't try to revise all of the content. I don't believe you can recite all ~350 slides. Do the questions from the database. Prof. Qi likes to use those questions in midterm and final exams.

Midterm:
L1 Introduction
L2 Amino Acids
L3 Protein Structure I
L4 Protein Structure II
L5 Protein Function and Evolution
L6 Protein Technology
L7 Enzymes and Enzyme Reactions
L8 Enzyme Kinetics I
L9 Enzyme Kinetics II
L10 Enzyme Regulation
L11 Enzyme Cofactors & Coenzymes

Final:
L13 Lipids
L14 Biomembranes
L15 Carbohydrates I
L16 Carbohydrates II
L17 Nucleic Acids
L18 Chromatin Structure
L19 DNA Replication
L20 DNA Repair & Recombination
L21 Transcription & RNA Processing
L22 Protein Synthesis
L23 Genetic Engineering
reviews.comment_teaching: Pretty good. His voice would make you laugh your ass off. He has a eunuch voice (Prof. Qi, sorry about that). But he is really helpful if you go and ask him during the break in the middle of his lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Really GOOD!!!
Top 20% will get at least an A-. Worth to pay much effort in this course.
I was ~0.7 SD above the mean in midterm and ~1.8 SD above the mean in final. Fortunately, I got an A.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload at all. Prof. Qi offers lecture videos which means you would not have to attend his lectures. Bear in mind, some of his lecture videos don't have visual aids.

reviews.author: Wong Sze Pui
reviews.comment_content: If you have biology and chemistry background, it would not be that hard for you. There is lecture video provided so if you have anything do not understand, you can follow the lecture video.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teaching, easy to understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading.
I got 3 marks higher than mean in midterm and 6marks lower than mean in final. At last I got a B-.
50% midterm 50% final
In midterm, it is all mc but final has short questions to answer.
reviews.comment_workload: Only midterm and final. No assignment or quiz. One powerpoint per lecture.

reviews.author: Shin, Woo-hong
reviews.title: GOOOOD course
reviews.comment_content:
Prof. C. Liang's part
Lipid
Biomembranes
Carbohydrate I
Carbohydrate II
Nucleic Acids
Chromatin Organization
DNA Replication
DNA Repair & Recombination
Transcription & RNA Processing
Translation
Genetic Engineering

Prof. S. Dang's part
Amino Acids
Protein Structure I, II
Protein Function and Evolution
Protein Technology
Enzymes and Enzyme Reactions
Enzyme Kinetics I, II
Enzyme Regulation
Enzyme Cofactors & Coenzymes

Learning these contents is very worthwhile. This course would help you to study other biology courses.
reviews.comment_teaching: They both are good lecturers. They answered any questions that I raised after the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are only two exams.
I got A- and I am satisfied with the grading.
reviews.comment_workload: Even though there are only two exams, you need to memorize a lot of things to get a high mark. Reviewing the course material would definitely help you.

reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is OK when in class. Might be a bit difficult to hear them clearly in Zoom. Most content for the exams are based on the slides.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is alright ~top 20% A range
reviews.comment_workload: No assignments just study lecture notes

reviews.author: ggg_
reviews.title: Good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
1. Introduction
2. Lipids
3. Biomembranes
4. Carbohydrates
5. Nucleic Acids
6. Chromatin Organization
7. DNA replication
8. DNA repair and recombination
9. Transcription and RNA processing
10. Translation (Protein synthesis)
11. Genetic Engineering
------------Midterm (LIANG Chun) -------------
12. Amino acids
13. Protein Structure
14. Protein function and evolution
15. Protein technology
16. Enzymes and enzyme reactions
17. Enzyme kinetics
18. Enzyme regulation
19. Enzyme cofactors & coenzymes
reviews.comment_teaching:
LIANG Chun:
I think prof. LIANG doesn't explain things very clearly especially the part of lipids and carbohydrate. Maybe part of the reason is that he was undergoing quarantine at that time, but he really seems very unprepared for the lectures. He usually speaks as if he is chewing something (or drunk?).. don't know how to describe the way he talks.  Plus that the lecture time is always at noon or in the late afternoon, his lectures are quite torturous for me. I prefer reading the textbooks to really have a clear idea about the topic... But there will be more contents on the book than on his notes, so maybe it would be best if you can take a cross reference since he is only testing those on his slides. The contents he taught regarding DNA in this course is almost identical to those in LIFS1902 and even less thorough. My friends taking LIFS3010 at the same time said that it is good to take these two courses together as some contents (prof. LIANG's part) overlap.
DANG Shangyu:
Some people think his accent is unbearable, but I think it is acceptable. In my opinion, his lectures and notes are way more organized than prof.LIANG's. He always summarizes what we have learnt last lecture, teaches new content, and then gives in-class exercises for us to practice. The summary part is not on the slides provided, nor are the learning-checks, but he made the in-class exercise into one ppt and upload it and the corresponding answers for our revision before final exam, which is quite nice. He is also very patient to answer questions after lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Seems this course is known for good grading. The A range is quite big judging from the data of 21-22. (20.5%A range, which were 25 people) (But we have many more people this year, don't know the exact criteria)
Both midterm and final are all MCs. 80MC for midterm and around 70 MC for final (don't remember the exact number lol)
Me:
Midterm: 78.75/100 (rank around the 9th) high: 86.25/100
Final: not released, but I think I only got a few questions wrong
Letter Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not big. I think attending lectures and do revision regularly is enough. (Cramming beore the exam is ok if you have to do this) For the midterm, the options can almost all be found on prof.LIANG's slides, changing several words (then wrong) or no change at all. He might talk about something not on the slides during the lectures. It is nice if you remembered it, but it will not appear in the exam. Just remember everything on his slides. For prof.DANG, the questions and options are also not tricky and basically just what appeared on the slides and taught in the class.

reviews.author: King527
reviews.title: A normal course
reviews.comment_content:
The content is ok. Not very bad or very good.

Liang Chun
1. Lipids
2. Biomembranes
3. Carbohydrates
4. Nucleic acids
5. Chromatin organization
6. DNA replication
7. DNA repair and Recombination
8. Transcription and RNA processing
9. Translation
10. Genetic engineering

DANG
1. Amino acids
2. Protein structure
3. Protein function
4. Protein technology
5. Enzymes and enzyme reactions
6. Enzyme kinetics
7. Enzyme regulation
8. Enzyme cofactors
reviews.comment_teaching: I don't think the instructors are very good at teaching. They usually just read the Powerpoint. It was quite boring at times. However, they were willing to talk to students. So I guess they are alright.
reviews.comment_grading:
The top 20% can get into the A range. So it is not that bad. There was 1 mid-term and 1 final. All questions were MC.

Mid-term: 77.5/100  (mean and median were 55)
Final: not released
Final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was light. There was no homework or other stuff. However, there were a lot of things to recite (e.g., 20 amino acids). So  I would suggest you revise earlier.

reviews.author: Depress1on1st
reviews.title: Lenient grading course
reviews.comment_content:
The content is pretty easy compared to LIFS 1902, with not a heavy workload, slides are pretty straightforward and self-explanatory. If you can do well in LIFS 1902 (memorizing all stuff), this is a piece of cake. The chemical structure of biomolecules is taught but the details won't be tested in the midterm. Some contents repeated with other LIFS courses. Teaching is fine.

Liang Chun
1. Lipids
2. Biomembranes
3. Carbohydrates
4. Nucleic acids
5. Chromatin organization
6. DNA replication
7. DNA repair and Recombination
8. Transcription and RNA processing
9. Translation
10. Genetic engineering

DANG
1. Amino acids
2. Protein structure
3. Protein function
4. Protein technology
5. Enzymes and enzyme reactions
6. Enzyme kinetics
7. Enzyme regulation
8. Enzyme cofactors
reviews.comment_teaching:
Liang Chun's teaching is alright, probably above average in HKUST and his content is not very difficult.
Dang has a thicker accent which would take several lectures to get used to. He is willing to answer questions after class.
Both lecturers also attached Youtube videos for students to review some particular abstract content.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is lenient, 20% student A range.
reviews.comment_workload: Just one midterm and one final. Only MCs, adequate time is given for you to complete them. Not hard at all.

reviews.author: dicck
reviews.title: Normal course
reviews.comment_content:
workload is low but many content needed to remember.
There are around 12-15 ch to study which is quite hard and complicated.
Most of the content is about the chemical  compound and process in our body
reviews.comment_teaching:
professor QI provided many knowledgeable and the lesson time is short.
However, his lesson is boring and many of the students choose to skip the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
the mean is ok... Mean= C - C+
you need to study hard to get a higher marks .
reviews.comment_workload:
low workload (0 assignment)
1 midterm and 1 final.
all closed book
You can get a practice question to prepare ur final

reviews.author: letmegohome
reviews.title: GREAT TEACHING
reviews.comment_content:
• Part I The Realm of Biochemistry
• Chapter 1 The Scope of Biochemistry
• Chapter 2 The Matrix of Life: Weak Interactions in an Aqueous Environment
• Chapter 3 The Energetics of Life
• Part II Molecular Architecture of Living Matter
• Chapter 4 Nucleic Acids
• Chapter 5 Introduction to Proteins: The Primary Level of Protein Structure
• Chapter 6 The Three-Dimensional Structure of Proteins
• Chapter 7 Protein Function and Evolution
• Chapter 8 Proteins in Motion: Contractile Systems and Molecular Motors
• Chapter 9 Carbohydrates: Sugars, Saccharides, Glycans
• Chapter 10 Lipids, Membranes, and Cellular Transportation
• Part III Dynamics of Life: Catalysis and Control of Biochemical Reactions
• Chapter 11 Enzymes: Biological Catalysts
• Chapter 12 Chemical Logic of Metabolism
• Part IV Dynamics of Life: Energy, Biosynthesis, and Utilization of Precursors
• Chapter 13 Carbohydrate Metabolism: Glycolysis, Gluconeogenesis, Glycogen Metabolism, and the Pentose Phosphate
Pathway
• Chapter 14 Citric Acid Cycle and Glyoxylate Cycle
• Chapter 15 Electron Transport, Oxidative Phosphorylation, and Oxygen Metabolism
• Chapter 16 Photosynthesis
• Chapter 17 Lipid Metabolism I: Fatty Acids, Triacylglycerols, and Lipoproteins
• Chapter 18 Interorgan and Intracellular Coordination of Energy Metabolism in Vertebrates
• Chapter 19 Lipid Metabolism II: Membrane Lipids, Steroids, Isoprenoids, and Eicosanoids
• Chapter 20 Metabolism of Nitrogenous Compounds: Principles of Biosynthesis, Utilization, and Turnover
• Chapter 21 Metabolism of Nitrogenous Compounds: Amino Acids, Porphyrins, and Neurotransmitters
• Chapter 22 Nucleotide Metabolism
• Chapter 23 Mechanisms of Signal Transduction
• Part V Information
• Chapter 24 Genes, Genomes, and Chromosome
• Chapter 25 DNA Replication
• Chapter 26 DNA Restructuring: Repair, Recombination, Rearrangement, Amplification
• Chapter 27 Information Readout: Transcription and Post-transcriptional Processing
• Chapter 28 Information Decoding: Translation and Post-translational Protein Processing
• Chapter 29 Regulation of Gene Expression
5
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Qi is one of the best Profs I know in UST.
His lectures are highly organized, and he has a great sense of humor.
I went to all the lectures, which is rare for me.
reviews.comment_grading: I think this course is known for good grading
reviews.comment_workload: Very light

reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Robert teaches very well.
But make sure u revise the lecture ppt before the lecture so u know what is happening
reviews.comment_grading:
There are 4 assessment components for this course: 1 midterm (45%), 1 Final (45%), and 2 Quizzes (@5%)

Time allowed: Quiz 1=20 mins Midterm=90 mins Quiz 2=20 mins Final=90 mins

Quiz 1: 8/10 (Mean:6.3 SD:Unknown High:10/10 Low:2/10)
Midterm: 58/70 (Mean:43.9 SD:8.036 High:64/70 Low:20/70)
quiz 2: 9/10 (Mean 8.6/10 SD:Unknown High:10/10 Low:4/10)
Final: 68/90 (Mean 52.6/90 SD:10.224 High:78/90 Low:30/90)
Letter Grade: A (Tragic)

I kept making careless mistakes, otherwise, my grade could have been better.
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload is light.
Doing the revision and memorizing all the details weeks before the exam is enough (P.S. Just for Reference only)

reviews.comment_teaching: People said he teaches very well. I dunno as I almost skipped all lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grade, mean is B-/B probably
Very easy to get A range, a wash grade course for all lifs students

Midterm 45%, Final 45%, Quiz 10%
My score:
Midterm: 61/70
Final: 71/90
Quiz 1: 9/10, Quiz 2: 10/10
Grade: A+

The easiest lifs course I have ever taken. Midterm is quite straightforward, just do a little bit of recite work can get high marks. Final need to know the concepts well. I didn't study much for the final cuz i have not enough time to study but still not too low cuz my concepts are clear.
reviews.comment_workload: No workloads. Both quizzes are super easy, I think even for high school students, they can get full mark easily.

reviews.author: Demeter0321
reviews.title: Fairly ok course
reviews.comment_content:
The content matches my expectations. It is a higher level course that requires a deeper understanding of the subject. You can get high marks if you memorize facts well enough. You will do fine if your DSE biology was good.

Outline:
Friday, 03/09 Introduction of Biochemistry
Monday, 06/09 Amino Acids
Friday, 10/09 Protein Structure I
Monday, 13/09 Protein Structure II
Friday, 17/09 Protein Function and Evolution
Monday, 20/09 Protein Technology
Friday, 24/09 Enzymes & Enzymatic Reactions
Monday, 27/09 Enzyme Kinetics I
Monday, 04/10 Enzyme Kinetics II
Friday, 08/10 Enzyme Regulation
Monday, 11/10 Enzyme Cofactors & Coenzymes
Friday, 15/10 Course Review / Tutorial / Quiz
Tuesday, 19/10 Mid-term Examination (7:00 pm – 8:30 pm, CYT-LTL)
Friday, 22/10 Lipids
Monday, 25/10 Biomembranes
Friday, 29/10 Carbohydrates I
Monday, 01/11 Carbohydrates II
Friday, 05/11 Nucleic Acids
Monday, 08/11 Chromatin Organization
Friday, 12/11 DNA Replication
Monday, 15/11 DNA Repair and Recombination
Friday, 19/11 Transcription and RNA Processing
Monday, 22/11 Protein Synthesis
Friday, 26/11 Genetic Engineering
Monday, 29/11 Course Review / Tutorial / Quiz
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor always ends the lesson 30 minutes earlier than scheduled. Unprofessional. Was expecting him to explain more but he said we should study on our own because this is not a beginner's course.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload. No homework whatsoever. 1 midterm, 1 final, 2 quizzes. You might want to do more extra reading/exercise to help with memorizing the content.

reviews.author: Hate1012
reviews.title: Fabulous teaching and good course
reviews.comment_content:
This course is the foundation course for all life science students.

Content before the midterm mainly focused on:
- Amino acid
- Proteins
- Enzymes.

Content after the midterm mainly focused on:
- Lipids
- Carbohydrates
- DNA + RNA translation & transcription
- Genetic engineering.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Qi is the best and cutest teacher I have ever seen in UST!!!!

His notes were concise and easy to follow, you can rarely see a load of words in his PowerPoint.The cartoons and pictures he put in his notes were reasonable and very useful at the same time, the would definitely help you to memorize the content easily.

He's funny and energetic. His voice is gentle and he's patient and welcome to answer students' questions during the break and after the lessons. You won't feel afraid to ask him any questions (Although I didn't ask him question haha)!
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair but near to good.
Only 1 midterm + 1 final.

Midterm: (My score: 44)
Low: 0 /75
Mean: 45.4 /75
Highest: 68 /75

Final: (My score: 75)
Low: 0 /100
Mean: 60.3 /100
Highest: 89 /100

Finally, I got B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
I think the content before midterm is more difficult than after midterm, the overall content was quite easy to understand though.

There were no many special terms that required you to remember but you have to put more effort to remember the structure and names of 20 amino acids.

Only 1 midterm + 1 final, no quizzes and no assignment.
I would say that the workload is lighttttttt!!!!!!

reviews.comment_teaching: He teaches patiently with heart. He has extremely good time management, meaning that ending the lessons within an hour. You can ask him questions after class and he explains clearly and even uses visual aids!

reviews.comment_workload: Not that high. Memorization is important for this course.

reviews.author: 一位不愿意透露姓名的少女
reviews.title: Easy, Relatively Organized As A LIFS Course
reviews.comment_content:
Has been listed.
Forgive my laziness.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Robert QI is okay.
Tried hard to be humorous. But most of the people can only be amused by his funny facial expression and voice.
PPT is organized most of the time with clear headlines.

What is special for Robert is that after midterm he would end the lesson in advance , which lead to several 50-min lecture videos, which is good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Robert QI assigned grades this semester like an angel.

He gave more than 20% A this time.
50% midterm  50% final
midterm: high 68 out of 75
               mean 45.4

final: high 89 out of 100
         mean 60.3

for me: midterm65  final86
termed out to be a A+

Honestly I paid no more effort than other courses of LIFS but this course is veritably my first A+ in my disheartening pathway of biology. So this course must be GOOD GRADING!!!
reviews.comment_workload:
Only midterm and final.
Prepare 3 days in advance for final is more than enough.
GOOD LUCK!!

reviews.author: CY
reviews.comment_content:
1. Amino Acids
2. Protein Structure
3. Protein Function and Evolution
4. Protein Technology
5. Enzyme and Enzyme Reaction
6. Enzyme Kinetics
7. Enzyme Regulation
8. Enzyme Cofactors and Coenzymes
9. Lipis
10. Biomembranes
11. Carbohydates
12. Nucleic Acids
13. Chromatin Organisation
14. DNA Replication
15. DNA Repair and Recombination
16. Transcription and RNA processing
17. Protain Synthesis
18. Genetic Engineering

Text book
-Biochemistry (4th edition) by Mathews, Van Holde and Ahern
Reference books
-Biochemistry (7th edition) by Berg, Tymoczko and Stryer
-Lehninger Principles of Biochemistry (6th edition) by Nelson and Cox
reviews.comment_teaching: Often skip lessons. So I actually may not be able to give an idea of the teaching style of Robert Qi. According to the lessons I have attended, he follows the lecture slides with clear description. His English is understandable.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think it has to be considered as a good-graded course according to the norm of UST

Mid-term exam statistics
High:68/75
Mean:45.4/75
Low:0/75
Me:47/75

Final exam statistics
High:89/100
Mean:60.3/100
Low:0/100
Me:67.5/100

My final grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload: Very light. Only consists of one mid-term exam and one final exam.

reviews.author: mickeyc
reviews.title: GOOD tutor and Easy to get A
reviews.comment_content: Included the macromolecules like carbonhydrates, Protein, Lipids, DNA and some cutting-edge topic like genome editting is mentioned. Notes are pretty organised and comprehensible.
reviews.comment_teaching: Humorous tutor that gives a lot of good jokes. Also a 5 mins break is the highight that allows u to stretch a little bit and go to toilet.
reviews.comment_grading: I got a quite decent grade though, if you read through the lec notes he offered, it s not that difficult to get B or above
reviews.comment_workload:
No assignment!
No fk annoying webwork!

ALL you need is a mid-term and a final, must take course!!!!!

reviews.author: corn soup
reviews.title: good course
reviews.comment_content:
- Amino Acids
- Protein Structure
- Protein Function and Evolution
- Protein Technology
- Enzymes and Enzyme Reaction
- Enzyme Kinetics
- Enzyme Regulation
- Enzyme Cofactors and Coenzymes
- Lipids
- Biomembranes
- Carbohydrates
- Nucleic Acids
- Chromatin Organization
- DNA Replication
- DNA Repair and Recombination
- Transcription and RNA Processing
- Protein Synthesis
- Genetic Engineering
reviews.comment_teaching: Robert is a good teacher. His teaching is easy to understand and interesting. I quite enjoy his class
reviews.comment_grading: Average. Not a good grade course but not a bad grade course.
reviews.comment_workload: No assignment. Only mid term and final exam. Read and memorize all lecture notes is ok.

reviews.author: Melodyyyyy
reviews.comment_content:
Basic biochemistry knowledge:
Before Midterm
- Amino Acids
- Protein Structure
- Protein Function and Evolution
- Protein Technology
- Enzymes and Enzyme Reaction
- Enzyme Kinetics
- Enzyme Regulation
- Enzyme Cofactors and Coenzymes
After Midterm:
- Lipids
- Biomembranes
- Carbohydrates
- Nucleic Acids
- Chromatin Organization
- DNA Replication
- DNA Repair and Recombination
- Transcription and RNA Processing
- Protein Synthesis
- Genetic Engineering
reviews.comment_teaching:
Delivers content effectively and efficiently.
Creates a good atmosphere in class.
Often ends the class within an hour.
reviews.comment_grading: Average.
reviews.comment_workload:
No assignment. Two exams.
Go through all the content in the lecture notes as well as the additional information mentioned by the professor in class.

reviews.author: C.ko
reviews.comment_content:
The content of the whole course is heavy, but with biology background would be ok. The power points are clear, with detailed explainations.

The content are listed below.

Midterm exam
L1 Introduction
L2 Amino Acids
L3 Protein Structure I
L4 Protein Structure II
L5 Protein Function and Evolution
L6 Protein Technology
L7 Enzymes and Enzyme Reactions
L8 Enzyme Kinetics I
L9 Enzyme Kinetics II
L10 Enzyme Regulation
L11 Enzyme Cofactors & Coenzymes

Final exam
L13 Lipids
L14 Biomembranes
L15 Carbohydrates I
L16 Carbohydrates II
L17 Nucleic Acids
L18 Chromatin Structure
L19 DNA Replication
L20 DNA Repair & Recombination
L21 Transcription & RNA Processing
L22 Protein Synthesis
L23 Genetic Engineering
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite good. The instructor explains various biochemical concepts  clearly. Also, you can ask questions during break time and he will answer and solve you enquiries surely. Review sessions are offered before both mid-term and final exams, which give you more information about the upcoming exams and some sample exam questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
quite good.
Midterm exam is a bit hard while the final is ok, provided that you did sufficient revision beforehand, instead of a few days before exam.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload at all. You just have to attend the lectures (twice a week) and lectures videos are provided. You can review the lectures anytime you want in canvas.

reviews.author: yaya
reviews.title: Love Prof Qi so much haha!
reviews.comment_content: Learn a lot about the basics of Biochemistry, for example amino acids, nucleic acids, protein structure and function, lipids, carbohydrates, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Firstly, I am scared of the course name of biochem because I am a biotech student. But Prof Qi teaches so detailed and he will explain every tiny basic thing clearly in case we forgot the basic concepts.

He will also have a 5-mins short break in the middle of the lesson. And after that he continues with his teaching and it feels so comfortable listening to his lecture. And he keeps all of us writing notes!
reviews.comment_grading: I put not much effort in the final exam but still have a B overall. quite good! but really need to pay much attention in the lecture and copy down ALL notes, or we must watch back the lecture video. Or else, we will find hard to catch up!
reviews.comment_workload: quite few, just need to pay attention in lesson and copy notes. be hard working!!

reviews.author: biochemnerd
reviews.title: Good course, covers all basics about biochem
reviews.comment_content:
Covers basics, such as macro molecules, simple reactions, formations and details necessary to understand structure/composition of biological stuff.
Here's a list of things covered (its not ordered, see outline for details):
- Amino Acids, Proteins
- Enzyme Kinetics & Regulation (highlight of the course tbh lol)
- Lipids
- Sugars
- Nucleic Acids
- DNA Transcription/Translation/Synthesis
- Some applications of biochem (working of biotech stuff like
  machines and genetically modified food, for example)
No point in buying textbook unless you are kind that loves to learn by reading. Course content only based on ppt, and prof dedicates a review session each before midterm and final which is good enough.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Qi has been one of the best prof I've had the opportunity to be taught from. He spends time to cover all details, does not read from the slides much (which is good and bad, coz then you have to sometimes pay attention to ppt notes and read long paragraphs yourself). Otherwise he likes to discuss some example review questions as well as mention everyday examples.
His accent is a little confusing sometimes, but mostly is perfectly understandable (a rare quality for profs at UST lmao)
He uploads lecture videos, so you can skip classes if you'd want to. I would say you can find other uni lec videos online too if this class doesnt work for you, as content is quite similar around the world for an introductory level biochem course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is okay... I was quite surprised with my grade actually, was better than I estimated.
50% midterm
(90 MCQ, which was so hard to finish in 70 mins T_T)
50% final
(80 MCQ, 20 short answer)
Overall mean for course was 58.93% and SD was 13.74. Not sure, but mean grade was likely to be B-
Anywhere above 1 SD could land you with A- or higher, so try your best to score well :)
reviews.comment_workload: Even though there are only 2 lec/ week, you have to spend time outside class to make notes and reinforce concepts. Content is not that hard, but takes a while to practice and remember. MCQs are tricky as heck, so be careful whether it says which one is TRUE or NOT TRUE and stuff like that (even I made some rookie mistakes here).

reviews.author: Andy HK
reviews.title: effort does pay off
reviews.comment_content:
amino acid, protein structure, protein function and evolution, protein technology, enzyme and enzymatic reaction, enzyme kinetics, enzyme regulation, enzyme cofactor and coenzyme, lipids, biomembrane, carbohydrates, nucleic acid, chromatin structure , dna replication, dna repair and recombination, transcription and rna processing, protein synthesis, genetic engineering.
The topics starting from DNA replication are difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching:
There are some learning checks in each lecture to help you study and lecture videos are provided.
There is a break at each lecture.
Professor Qi is nice and approachable, many students ask him questions during the break of each lecture and he is pleased to answer the question.
There were review sessions before mid term and final exam, which are the summary of the exam content and is quite useless i think. But he would finish the slides very quickly and the remaining time is Q&A session. You can ask him questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
I didn't expect to get a B grade because the overall percentage i get is only 59% which is equal to the mean. I am under the impression that i only get B-
For mid term exam, we only had MCQ, but many students could not finish all questions due to the lack of time because the paper had 90 questions if i remember correctly,
For mid term exam, it had MCQ and short questions and you will have enough time to finish all the questions.
reviews.comment_workload: Only has mid term and final exam.

reviews.author: Little_Duck
reviews.comment_content:
Even though this is not a introductory course the content is quite simple. The things are not really complicated and difficult to understand.

Here are the topics that will be covered in the course:
Amino Acids
Protein Structure
Protein Function and Evolution
Protein Technology
Enzymes & Enzymatic Reactions
Enzyme Kinetics
Enzyme Regulation
Enzyme Cofactors & Coenzymes
Lipids
Biomembranes
Carbohydrates
Carbohydrates
Nucleic Acids
Chromatin Structure
DNA Replication
DNA Repair and Recombination
Transcription and RNA Processing
Protein Synthesis
Genetic Engineering
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching of the professor is easy to follow and understand. Sometimes, he will ask a few questions before he goes to teach a new topic to check your understanding. His teaching is not bad. However, maybe you will find a little bit uncomfortable with his accent in the first few lessons, but once you get used to it, there is no big deal.
reviews.comment_grading: I myself don't really study hard for the exams and got a B- in the end. If you want to ace this course, I recommend you pay attention to details and try to mesmerize the name of some chemical and amino acids. Actually, maybe you wish to study the table of amino acids earlier as probably you won't have enough time to mesmerize all of them before a week of the exam.
reviews.comment_workload: There are no assignments nor readings in this course, but I recommend you to study the course material after the lessons to help you consolidate the knowledge.

reviews.author: ym7135
reviews.title: Fundamental knowledge in Life Science - taught really well
reviews.comment_content:
The entire course is subdivided into 5 main parts:
- Intro to Biochem (very short)
- Proteins (Amino acids, protein folding, enzymes)
(Mid term)
- Lipids
- Carbohydrates
- Nucleic Acids
(Finals)

At least 60-70% of the Intro, lipids and carbohydrates should already be familiar from high school knowledge. Most students say the protein part is most difficult because there are some equations to remember (not a lot), but overall this course isn't too difficult, I would say it was easier than 1902. The mid-term and final is non-accumulative . Also, the course itself has very clear learning outcomes and presentation, so it was very easy to study for. This course is necessary for all 3 LIFS majors because the information is very useful for each of them.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very good - What I like about his teaching and his lectures is that there are very clear learning outcomes -  it is clear what we need to know. He goes straight to the point and explains things very well. Even though he has a slight accent, his English is very fluent and he seems like he has a lot of years of experience. I highly suggest going to his lectures or watching the lecture videos - it saves you a lot of time because he is addressing a lot of the exam questions indirectly.

Also, he gives a lot of class MCQs in he lecture (usually like in the beginning or end) and they end up being in the exam so it is an added benefit !!!
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite fair, the professor has mentioned the top 20% getting an A, and subsequent 30% getting a B. The mean is around B-. Since the course is not difficult and the exam was easy, the mean is quite high and this makes it difficult to get a high grade. In my sem:

- Mid term:  Mean= 50/90 , highest: 81/90
- Finals:  Mean= 63/100, highest: 93/100  

The standard deviation for both is also quite high so you may want to make sure you remember every single detail in the lecture ppts. The mid term was only 90 MCQs, and the final was 80 MCQs and 20 points worth of short questions (which I find easier than the MCQs), but frankly at least 50% of the questions could be done without taking the course cuz its easy, and even after studying it 80% of the questions are just so obvious.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only prep for mid-term and finals, which is 50% each and non-cumulative. A lot of students (including me) found the mid-term more difficult than the finals.

In all honesty, going to his lectures (or lecture vid) and his notes are GOOD ENOUGH, the textbook goes over too much that is not needed in this course.

reviews.author: ronnieronnie
reviews.comment_content: This course talks about the fundamental knowledge of biochemistry including amino acid structure, organic compounds (before mid-term) , lipid and DNA structure (after mid-term). The course content is simple and easy but useful. Just memorize. It is better to go through the textbook.
reviews.comment_teaching: The pronunciation of professor is a bit difficult to hear (but it is common problem of mainland professors). The course material is simple and plain so it does not require detail explanation. So his lecture is not so difficult to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: A little bit strict. If you slightly below mean you may have a chance to get C+. About mean 1.2~1.3 SD may get A-
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload. Just 1 midterm and 1 final. Final is non-cumulative. If you are good at memorizing, this course is very easy and relaxing.

reviews.author: Zain
reviews.comment_content: Before the midterm the content is about amino acids, protein structures and enzymes and the second part is mainly about lipids, carbonhydrates, DNA and RNA. The content about enzymes and nucleic acids focuses on the mechanisms such as some equations and metabolism processes. On the other hand, the content about other biomolecules requries memorization of the structures and their derivatives, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Most of the content can be found in the lecture notes and the teaching gives some explanations. Sometimes the instructor skipped some details but he was willing to talk more after the lectures (those details weren't included in the exams).
reviews.comment_grading: The midterm was all MC (80 questions) and the final exam consisted of MC and short questions. The mean was around 50% out of the full score so the grade was relatively good if one gets familiar with the content.
reviews.comment_workload: There was only midterm and final exams for this course and 90% of the questions were MC. Therefore, it doesn't require much memorization for the spelling of the words. However, sufficient time should be taken to review the content (about 1 hour for each lecture) because of the details of different biomolecules. Generally, the understanding is more important for the enzyme kenetics and processes such as DNA replication and repair and the memorization is essential for the structure, reactions, naming of the distinct molecules.

reviews.author: diudiu
reviews.title: Quintessential LIFS course
reviews.comment_content:
Foundational contents for any biochemistry/biological science/biotechnology students, covering materials regarding basic biochemicals like proteins, lipids, carbohydrates, and DNA.
Truly an epitome of HKUST's life science courses, as all the contents of the course are repeated time and again in other life science course, no matter entry level ones (1902) or higher ones (3140), as if all the things taught by the faculty was organized in a gigantic spiral of knowledge.

To be honest, considering how important this course is for life science students, they should seriously think about changing this to a year 1 course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Robert Qi is a nice professor who would not hesitate to answer your questions. As mainland professors go, his accent is not too difficult to understand, and he compensates for this accent with clear, confident deliveries in his lectures.
Into the later parts of the semester, he would often end the lectures early as there was not a lot of materials to cover.
reviews.comment_grading:
According to qirz, the top 20% get A range, and the next 30% B range, so the mean grade is about B-.
Midterm and Final exams are in equal proportions, and are non-cumulative. The midterm consists entirely of MC, but time is rather tight so it sort of favours fast thinkers; the final exam is mostly MC, but with a couple short questions thrown in. Both are not particularly difficult I'll say.
Midterm mean 46.4/80, max 72
Final mean 67.5/100, max 94
reviews.comment_workload: The contents are straight forward and easy to understand, and if you want to do well in this course, all you need to do is memorise everything on qirz's slides and regurgitate them during the exams. However, this course covers way less information than 1902, so tbh it is even easier than that. Just spend a day each for the exams and you'll be alright.

reviews.author: Steph Leung
reviews.title: Not for the faint-hearted
reviews.comment_content: The content are pretty interesting IMO. Mainly focusing on protein folding, amino acids etc. Something worth noting is that at times the content will drill pretty deep.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching was okay, however it might be difficult to get used to his accent for the first few lessons, afterwards you will be fine. As for lecturing, he tends to read the PPTS however at times he would make additional comments to specific slides, thus it might worth going through his lectures if you're interested to the topic.
reviews.comment_grading: To be fair i think the grading is okay. However if you are bad in memorising informations or careless it might be difficult since most of the marks lies in MCQ and  LQ rarely appears. Personally speaking, I think it would be better if you take the course in year 2, some of the contents overlaps with lifs 1902 so you will have less contents to remember. :)
reviews.comment_workload: Pretty light workload. No group work or projects. The grading is totally based on exams.

reviews.author: cheeeeeeeeee
reviews.comment_content:
The content is not as much complicated; but there are many things for rote-memorization such as amino acids and various types of vitamins.
You get to learn about various biomolecules in basic level including
- proteins / a.a.
- minerals
- lipids
- carbohydrates
plus DNA replication, transcription and translation,
and some basic biotechnology
reviews.comment_teaching:
He basically follows the powerpoint so there's no need to go to the lecture actually. The lecture video is also uploaded on canvas so you will manage to just look for the video if you feel the lecture note is not enough.
He is quite straight forward, and his pronounciation is quite clear, considering he is a mainland professor
reviews.comment_grading: Not so bad; I did't study much for both midterm and final but was able to get B+  overall. If you get to memorize everything on the content, you will be able to target A, I think.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload; there only midterm and final, which is 50:50.
Only study for the exams, but you won't be able to cram everything just the night before, so take at least three full days for studying.

reviews.author: 孤獨的美食家
reviews.title: Lifs Major必修
reviews.comment_content:
Overall is easy to study
Started with classifying 20 different AAs. Then the formation of Protein from simple AAs. How to build the 1st to 4th level of Protein structures.
Then will be DNA replication and Transcription, Translation. Not very detailed.
The content is straight forward, but you have to spend time to memerize
reviews.comment_teaching:
Robert is a mainland prof, but his pronounciation is understandable. Except his “th-” sounds will turns to “s-” sounds.
But he was always just follow the ppt. I dont think you will miss any thing if you skipped his lessons.
Quick answering after the lesson.
(No video provided)
reviews.comment_grading:
MT Above mean ~1.2SD
Final above ~1SD
Overall A

As there are lots of candidates, mixed with 3 majors (BCB, BIO, BioT), if you are good at biology before, you may easily get a B range or above.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload
As it has only MT and Final.
He will upload some online homework to the LMES, but they are not counted as part of your scores. Only provided for your revision. I suggest you to do all of thr homework before going to the exams.

reviews.author: @33YYY
reviews.comment_content: 每堂都有recording 可以睇番，不過基本上淨係照讀PPT，都幾悶下。會有埋其他嘅videos for理解。
reviews.comment_teaching: 講真太悶，可以淨係去最後一堂mark重點，其他基本上可以唔使上。
reviews.comment_grading: grade就仲未出。
reviews.comment_workload: 冇Homework，ONLY mid-term ＋final。全部MC。midterm 係75 條MC，基本上考緊嘅都係啲memories嘅野。

reviews.author: Sonic12
reviews.title: Review of LIFS 2210
reviews.comment_content:
Part 1 (Professor Shangyu Dang)
1. Introduction of Biochemistry
2. Amino Acids
3. Protein Structure I
4. Protein Structure II
5. Protein Function and Evolution
6. Protein Technology
7. Enzymes & Enzymatic Reactions
8. Enzyme Kinetics I
9. Enzyme Kinetics II
10. Enzyme Regulation
11. Enzyme Cofactors & Coenzymes
----------------Mid-term Examination------------------------
Part 2 (Professor Chun Liang)
12. Lipids
13. Biomembranes
14. Carbohydrates I
15. Carbohydrates II
16. Nucleic Acids
17. Chromatin Organization
18. DNA Replication
19. DNA Repair and Recombination
20. Transcription and RNA Processing
21. Protein Synthesis
22. Genetic Engineering
-----------------------Final Examination-----------------------
The course covers mostly biomolecules and their properties. Many contents overlap with general biology II.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures 1 to 11 are covered by professor Shangyu Dang.

As the course is delivered in mixed-mode, first the students watch the main lecture videos for each session, then discuss problems related to lecture videos in the face-to-face session. The professor's teaching is fair but I think the mixed-mode is a kind of a waste of time. Many students do not attend f2f sessions and actually by just watching the lecture videos the preparation for the midterm exam is sufficient.

Lectures 12 to 22 are covered by professor Liang Chun.
In part 2, professor Chun returns to typical one-way teaching which seems better than orthodox mixed-mode. However, still, this course is delivered in mixed-mode the professor asks us to self-study for the lecture contents and often omits the details in lecture slides that are required for the final exam.

Overall, the two professors' teaching is fine but as the course is mixed-mode, there's some inefficiency in the teaching and delivery.
reviews.comment_grading:
quiz (5%)
midterm (45%)
final (50%)

quiz
low: 1, mean: 6.4, high: 10, std: 1.92
me: 9/10

midterm
low: 16, mean: 43.2, high: 66, std: 11.42
me: 62/70

final (data not released)
me: 67/84

Overall: A+

Grading seems ok. The competition is not that fierce and the A range is quite wide.
reviews.comment_workload:
If you've experienced general biology I and II, the workload would be similar to them.

There's a small quiz just few days before the midterm exam and of course, there are midterm and final exams. The quiz and exams are not that hard if you reviewed the lecture materials well enough.

Just organize the contents in your note after each lecture and recite them regularly. You should be fine then.

reviews.author: KIKC
reviews.comment_content:
ALL LIFS students need to take this course in year 2 fall semester.

Midterm:
L1 Introduction
L2 Amino Acids
L3 Protein Structure I
L4 Protein Structure II
L5 Protein Function and Evolution
L6 Protein Technology
L7 Enzymes and Enzyme Reactions
L8 Enzyme Kinetics I
L9 Enzyme Kinetics II
L10 Enzyme Regulation
L11 Enzyme Cofactors & Coenzymes

Final:
L13 Lipids
L14 Biomembranes
L15 Carbohydrates I
L16 Carbohydrates II
L17 Nucleic Acids
L18 Chromatin Structure
L19 DNA Replication
L20 DNA Repair & Recombination
L21 Transcription & RNA Processing
L22 Protein Synthesis
L23 Genetic Engineering
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is quite good. He likes to answer the question from students. He explains all the things clearly. Sometimes he would prepare some mc questions to test your understanding.
reviews.comment_grading:
Due to COVID-19,
midterm: 50% to 80%
final: 50% to 20%

The grade is not quite good due to the change of grading . The mean is around C+/B-.
My midterm is below mean 0.2 s.d. and final is above 0.2 s.d.
Final grade: C :(

I think it should be better (not C) if the grading is midterm (50%) and final(50%)
reviews.comment_workload: Only one midterm and one final. The workload is moderate since the contents are hard to understand and revise.

reviews.author: 美要眇兮
reviews.title: One of the best courses I've taken
reviews.comment_content:
Given by three professors this term in the order of Prof Dang, Prof Qi, Prof Liang.

Talking about the key substances involved in the biological processes: proteins and polypeptides, lipids, carbohydrates and nucleic acids. Overall well-organized and somehow interesting.

Syllabus same as usual
Mid:
Prof Dang
L1 Introduction
L2 Amino Acids
L3-4 Protein Structure
L5 Protein Function and Evolution
L6 Protein Technology
Prof Qi
L7 Enzymes and Enzyme Reactions
L8-9 Enzyme Kinetics
L10 Enzyme Regulation
L11 Enzyme Cofactors and Coenzymes

Final:
Prof Qi
L13 Lipids
L14 Biomembranes
L15-16 Carbohydrates
Prof Liang
L17 Nucleic Acids
L18 Chromatin
L19 DNA Replication
L20 DNA Repair and Recombination
L21 Transcription and RNA Processing
L22 Protein Synthesis
Prof QI
L23 Genetic Engineering
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof QI is always passionate and enthusiastic to show what he is going to elaborate. While Prof LIANG is more calm and patient, also able to convey his ideas and explanations. Prof DANG is also willing to answer questions and explain things but his accent may bother some students, and his voice is not that powerful.
Sometimes the lectures are somehow boring. If the procedure of reading PPT starts, you may have a short rest lol
reviews.comment_grading:
Greatest grade ever! Easiest A-range to get as long as you do not give up and do some basic recite work.
2*10% quiz(before mid and final)
40% mid
40% final
from canvas data
mid: Hi:67 Mean:45.6
final: Hi:83 Mean:58
me: 62 in midterm and 75 in final
Still could get an A+! (Even though I am not a biology student!)
reviews.comment_workload:
Basically no.
Do your revision work before quiz and exam (just after the quiz so no double work needed) and there is nothing else.
If you are interested you may read the textbook recommended. I didn't. And I think it didn't affect anything.

reviews.author: MMF~~~
reviews.title: Grade Saviour
reviews.comment_content: Personally, I think 30% of the content is related to Organic Chemistry, so if u study this course with CHEM2110, u can gain a little advantage of understanding the content. Most content before the mid-term is high school knowledge, so it is very easy in mid-term. The course is related to amino acids, protein structure and function+technology, enzyme kinetics and regulation, enzyme cofactors, lipids, biomembranes, carbohydrates, nucleic acids, chromatin organisation, DNA replication, DNA repair and recombination, Transcription & RNA Processing, Protein Synthesis, Genetic Engineering. If u are good at high school biology and chemistry, u don't need many time to understand it.
reviews.comment_teaching: The accent of the professor is a big problem, so I would not suggest u to attend the lesson. Personally, I think only study the powerpoint given by the professor is enough for both mid-term and final.
reviews.comment_grading:
50% Mid-term (51/80) mean:45
                                                (all mc)
50% Final (60/120) mean:60                              
            (80%mc+20%short question)
Even though I have poor grade at final,
I still get B as my final grade after I request to check my final paper.
Professor Qi is quite generous on grading.
reviews.comment_workload: Only Mid-term and Final is required to grade the corse.

reviews.author: wwcoscar
reviews.title: Very Good grading
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture
Introduction of Biochemistry I
Amino Acids
Protein Structure (I)
Protein Structure (II)
Protein Function and Evolution
Protein Technology Enzymes & Enzymatic Reactions
Enzyme Kinetics (I)
Enzyme Kinetics (II)
Enzyme Regulation
Enzyme Cofactors & Coenzymes  
Lipids
Biomembrane
Carbohydrates (I)
Carbohydrates (II)
Nucleic Acids

Every lecture 3x pages only not much to remember ,Easy to understand
Textbook can help to know more
reviews.comment_teaching: English is okay. Interesting course. Robert always answer student question. Most of the lecture finished earlier so student can ask as many questions as you like.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very very good grade course
Midterm:60/75(mean:45/highest:68)
Final:78/100(mean:60.5/highest:89)
75MCQ for MT/Final: SQ&MCQ(80%)
Grade:A
Top 20%=A range
Mean~B
Above mean B+
Easy to get B range
reviews.comment_workload: Only MT and Final. Zero work load comparing other course. Textbook and reference books are recommended if you want A range. Textbook show the theory behind which may not covered in lecture. Some questions in reference book and online source may appear in the exam.

reviews.author: Kabul
reviews.title: Pre-eminent fundamental course. Mediocre teaching.
reviews.comment_content:
呢個 course 係好多其他 LIFS courses 嘅基礎，concept 一般唔難理解，但係量比較多，對於過目即忘嘅我係惡夢嚟...建議每次上完堂要重溫，唔好好似我咁 exam 前先睇過晒 D PowerPoint ，死得人。

個人認為 midterm 前 midterm 後嘅內容同埋讀嘅方法都幾唔同，midterm 前有一大堆 amino acid + vitamin 要背，同埋有 enzyme kinematics 有少少 mathematical models 要理解；midterm 後就係 lipids、carbohydates 同埋 DNA replication & repair mechanisms，concept 相對比較容易理解。

Before midterm:
🔷 L1 Introduction
🔷 L2 Amino Acids
🔷 L3 Protein Structure I
🔷 L4 Protein Structure II
🔷 L5 Protein Function and Evolution
🔷 L6 Protein Technology
🔷 L7 Enzymes and Enzyme Reactions
🔷 L8 Enzyme Kinetics I
🔷 L9 Enzyme Kinetics II
🔷 L10 Enzyme Regulation
🔷 L11 Enzyme Cofactors & Coenzymes

After midterm:
🔷 L13 Lipids
🔷 L14 Biomembranes
🔷 L15 Carbohydrates I
🔷 L16 Carbohydrates II
🔷 L17 Nucleic Acids
🔷 L18 Chromatin Structure
🔷 L19 DNA Replication
🔷 L20 DNA Repair & Recombination
🔷 L21 Transcription & RNA Processing
🔷 L22 Protein Synthesis
🔷 L23 Genetic Engineering

呢個 course 同 LIFS2070 biotech course 有部分重覆，不過呢度教得 fundamental 同仔細 D，讀好呢個 course 對理解 LIFS2070 有幫助。
reviews.comment_teaching: 麻麻地，雖然佢講嘢算清楚易明，但係太跟 PowerPoint 講。每次上完佢堂我完全 fu 唔到學咗 D 乜嘢，最後都係要 exam 之前 luk 過晒 D PowerPoint 重新學過晒，同冇上堂冇分別...
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 同 final 各佔 course grade 50%。

幾 surprised 下，我 midterm 炒到 hihi 最後都有 A。

✏️ Midterm: 59/90 (Mean = 50)
✏️ Final: 81.5/100 (Mean = 63.4)
Overall: 73.53/100 (Mean = 58.93, SD = 13.74)

💯 Final grade: A

我都係 overall 高 mean +1.06 SD，原本諗住得 A- 但係最後竟然攞到 A，都幾靚 grade。
reviews.comment_workload: 除咗 exam 冇其他 workload，但係寨溫書都已經令我好想跳菇。😭😭😭

reviews.author: michaelam
reviews.comment_content:
Basically about PROTEINS, AMINO ACID, CARBOHYDRATES, DNA etc.
DNA parts are similar to lifs 1902 especially transciption and translation ( overlapping materials)
BUT the concepts are VERY diffcult and theres A LOT TO REMEMBER!!
reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring lectures
A bit helpful attending lectures coz prof sometimes will talk about things beyond the ppt but somewhat useful in understanding concepts
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 51/80 (mean 46.4)
Final 75.5/100 (mean 67.5)

Final grade: B
reviews.comment_workload:
ONLY 1 midterm and 1 final
midterm: ALL MC
BUT many mc questions included things that beyond the scope of ppt materials (if u want a better grade, research more on the background info through wiki)
final incudes mainly mc and some short questions (u only have to write few words/matching -> basically testing ur understanding on the complicated concepts)

reviews.author: mc_cch
reviews.title: Biochemistry foundational course
reviews.comment_content: If you chose Biochemistry as your major, it is the main course of your 4-year study at UST.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. DANG was the lecturer of my session. He released the ZOOM recordings of the lectures from the previous year before the f2f lectures. During class, the professor encouraged students to share their opinions in the discussions. He would create some in-depth questions related to different modules. However, many of us were quite introverted and refused to talk together. So only a few students responded to the professor.  [>>B+]

I also joined the lectures delivered by QI, who was a patient and experienced professor. His lectures were easier to follow as he explained everything in the PPT in detail.  [>>A-]

Prof. LIANG was an expert in genetics, I enjoyed his lectures as the language he used was quite straightforward and understandable . [>>A]
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1: 6/10
Mt: 44/70
Final: ?

finally got B- ...
reviews.comment_workload:
Make sure you have enough time to 'digest' all the materials released on Canvas.

Luckily, group project and essay were not required
